text: Every first offspring of a womb is for me—all of your male livestock, the first offspring of cattle and small livestock.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the first offspring of a donkey you will redeem with small livestock, and if you will not redeem it, you will break its neck. Every firstborn of your sons you will redeem, and you will not appear before me empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days you will work, and on the seventh day you will rest; in the time of plowing and in the time of harvest you will rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you yourself will observe the Feast of Weeks—the firstfruits of the wheat harvest—and the Feast of Harvest Gathering at the turn of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times in the year all your males will appear before the Lord, Yahweh, the God of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: because I will evict nations before you, and I will enlarge your territory, and no one will covet your land when you go up to appear before Yahweh your God three times in the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You will not slaughter the blood of my sacrifice on food with yeast, and the sacrifice of the Feast of the Passover will not stay overnight to the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The beginning of the firstfruits of your land you will bring to the house of Yahweh your God. You will not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Write for yourself these words, because according to these words I have made a covenant with you and with Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was there with Yahweh forty days and forty nights. He ate no food and drank no water. And he wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the ten words.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses came down from Mount Sinai, the two tablets of the testimony were in the hand of Moses at his coming down from the mountain; and Moses did not know that the skin of his face shone because of his speaking with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron and all the Israelites saw Moses, and, to their amazement, the skin of his face shone, and they were afraid of coming near to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the leaders of the community returned to him, and Moses spoke to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward all the Israelites came near, and he commanded them all that Yahweh had spoken with him on Mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses finished speaking with them, and he put a veil on his face.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses came before Yahweh to speak with him, he would remove the veil until he went out, and he would go out and would speak to the Israelites what he had been commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Israelites would see the face of Moses, that the skin of the face of Moses shone, and Moses would put back the veil on his face until his coming to speak with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses assembled all the community of the Israelites, and he said to them, “These are the words that Yahweh has commanded for us to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: On six days work can be done, and on the seventh there will be for you a holy day, a Sabbath of complete rest, for Yahweh; anyone doing work on it will be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will not kindle a fire in any of your dwellings on the day of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said to all the community of the Israelites, saying, “This is the word that Yahweh has commanded, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Take from among you a contribution for Yahweh, anyone willing of heart, let him bring Yahweh’s contribution—gold and silver and bronze,
speaker: Narrator

text: and blue and purple and crimson yarns, and fine linen and goat hair,
speaker: Narrator

text: and red-dyed ram skins, and fine leather, and acacia wood,
speaker: Narrator

text: and oil for the lamp, balsam oils for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense,
speaker: Narrator

text: onyx stones and stones for mountings on the ephod and the breast piece.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And let all the skilled of heart among you come and make all that Yahweh has commanded:
speaker: Narrator

text: The tabernacle, its tent, and its covering; its clasps and its frames; its bars, its pillars, and its bases;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ark and its poles; the atonement cover and the curtain of the screen;
speaker: Narrator

text: the table and its poles and all its equipment; and the bread of the presence;
speaker: Narrator

text: and lampstand of the light and its equipment and its lamps and the oil for the light;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the altar of incense and its poles; and the anointing oil and the fragrant incense and the entrance curtain for the entrance of the tabernacle;
speaker: Narrator

text: the altar of the burnt offering and the bronze grating that is for it, its poles and all its equipment; the basin and its stand;
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the courtyard, its pillars, and its bases, and the screen for the courtyard gate;
speaker: Narrator

text: the pegs of the tabernacle and the pegs of the courtyard and their cords;
speaker: Narrator

text: the woven garments for serving in the sanctuary—the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons to serve as priests.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the community of the Israelites went out from before Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came—every man whose heart lifted him and every man whose spirit impelled him—they brought Yahweh’s contribution for the work of the tent of assembly and for all its service and for the holy garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came, the men in addition to the women, all who were willing of heart; they brought brooches and jewelry rings and signet rings and ornaments—every variety of gold object—every man who waved a wave offering of gold for Yahweh,
speaker: Narrator

text: and every man with whom was found blue and purple and crimson yarns and fine linen and goat hair and red-dyed ram skins and fine leather brought it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who were presenting a contribution of silver and bronze brought Yahweh’s contribution, and all with whom was found acacia wood for all the work of service brought it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And every woman who was skilled of heart with her hands they spun, and they brought yarn—the blue and the purple, the crimson and the fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the women whose heart lifted them with skill spun the goat hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the leaders brought the onyx stones and stones for mountings for the ephod and for the breast piece
speaker: Narrator

text: and the balsam oils and the oil for light and for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man and woman whose heart impelled them to bring for all the work to be done that Yahweh had commanded by the agency of Moses—the Israelites brought freely to Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said to the Israelites, “See, Yahweh has called by name Bezalel the son of Uri the son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he has filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom and with skill and with knowledge and with every kind of craftsmanship,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to devise designs, to work with the gold and with the silver and with the bronze,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in stonecutting for setting and in cutting wood, for doing every kind of design craftsmanship.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he has put it in his heart to teach—he and Oholiab the son of Ahisamach, from the tribe of Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has filled them with skill of heart to do every work of a craftsman and a designer and an embroiderer with the blue and with the purple, with the crimson yarns and with the fine linen and a weaver; they are doers of every kind of craftsmanship and devisers of designs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bezalel and Oholiab and everyone who is skilled of heart in whom Yahweh has put wisdom and skill to know and to do all the work for the service of the sanctuary—they will do it, according to all that Yahweh has commanded.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab and everyone skilled of heart, in whose heart Yahweh had put skill, all whose heart lifted him to come near to the work in order to do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took from Moses all the contributions that the Israelites had brought for the work of the service for the sanctuary in order to do it, and they still brought to him voluntary offerings every morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the skilled workers who were doing all the work for the sanctuary came, each from his work that they were doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to Moses, saying, “The people are bringing more than enough for the service of the work that Yahweh has commanded to be done.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses commanded, and they proclaimed the message in the camp, saying, “Let no man or woman again make anything for the sanctuary contribution.” And so the people were restrained from bringing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the material was enough for doing all the work, and it was left over.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all who were skilled of heart among the doers of the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains of finely twisted linen and blue and purple and crimson yarns, with cherubim; he made them, the work of a skilled craftsman.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of the one curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the width was four cubits for the one curtain; one measurement was for all the curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he joined five of the curtains one to another, and five curtains he joined one to another.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made loops of blue on the edge of the one curtain, at the end in the set; so he did on the edge of the end curtain in the second set.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made fifty loops on the one curtain, and he made fifty loops on the end of the curtain that was in the second set; the loops were opposite one to another.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made fifty gold clasps and joined the curtains one to another with the clasps, so that the tabernacle was one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made curtains of goat hair for a tent over the tabernacle; he made them eleven curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of the one curtain was thirty cubits, and the width was four cubits for the one curtain; one measure was for the eleven curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he joined five curtains together and six curtains together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made fifty loops on the edge of the end curtain in the set, and he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain in the second set.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made fifty bronze clasps for joining the tent to become one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made a covering for the tent of red-dyed ram skin and a covering of fine leather to go above.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the frames for the tabernacle of acacia wood as uprights.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of the frame was ten cubits, and the width of the one frame was one and a half cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made two pegs for the one frame for joining one to another and likewise for all the frames of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the frames for the tabernacle with twenty frames for the south side.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made forty silver bases under the twenty frames, with two bases under the one frame for its two pegs and two bases under the next frame for its two pegs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the second side of the tabernacle, the north side, he made twenty frames
speaker: Narrator

text: and their forty silver bases, with two bases under the one frame and two bases under the next frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the rear of the tabernacle on the west he made six frames.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made two frames for the tabernacle corners at the rear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were double at the bottom, and they were completely together on its top to the one ring; he did likewise for the two of them, for the two corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there were eight frames and their sixteen silver bases, two bases, two bases under the one frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made five bars of acacia wood for the frames on the one side of the tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: and five bars for the frames on the second side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the frames at the rear on the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the middle bar to run in the midst of the frames from end to end.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he overlaid the frames with gold, and he made their rings of gold as holders for the bars, and he overlaid the bars with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the curtain of blue and purple and crimson yarns and finely twisted linen, the work of a craftsman; he made it with cherubim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made for it four acacia pillars, and he overlaid them with gold, with their gold hooks, and he cast for them four silver bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made for the entrance of the tent a screen of blue and purple and crimson yarns and finely twisted linen, the work of an embroiderer,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the five pillars and their hooks, and he overlaid their tops and their connections with gold, and their five bases were bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits its length and a cubit and a half its width and a cubit and a half its height.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside, and he made for it a gold molding all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cast for it four gold rings on its four feet; and two rings were on its one side, and two rings were on its second side.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made poles of acacia wood, and he overlaid them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made an atonement cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits its length and a cubit and a half its width.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made two cherubim of gold; he made them of hammered work at the two ends of the atonement cover.
speaker: Narrator

text: One cherub was at one end, and one cherub was at the other end of the atonement cover; he made the cherubim at its two ends.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the cherubim were with outspread wings above, covering with their wings over the atonement cover and facing each other; the faces of the cherubim were toward the atonement cover.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the table of acacia wood, two cubits its length and a cubit its width and a cubit and a half its height.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he overlaid it with pure gold, and he made for it a gold molding all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made for it a handbreadth rim all around, and he made a gold molding for its rim all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cast for it four gold rings, and he put the rings on the four corners where its four legs were.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rings were near the rim as holders for the poles to carry the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the poles of acacia wood, and he overlaid them with gold to carry the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the vessels that were on the table—its plates and its ladles, and its bowls and its pitchers with which libations were poured—of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the lampstand of pure gold; he made the lampstand of hammered work—its base and its branch, its cups, its buds, and its blossoms were all part of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And six branches were going out from its sides, three branches of the lampstand from its one side and three branches of the lampstand from its second side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three almond-flower cups were on the one branch with a bud and a blossom, and three almond-flower cups were on the one branch with a bud and a blossom—likewise for the six branches going out from the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the lampstand were four almond-flower cups, with its buds and its blossoms.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a bud was under the two branches that came from it, and a bud under the two branches from it, and a bud under the two branches from it, likewise for the six branches coming out from the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their buds and their branches were from it, all of it one piece of pure gold, hammered work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made its seven lamps and its snuffers and its fire pans of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made it from a talent of pure gold and all its pieces of equipment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the incense altar of acacia wood, a cubit its length and a cubit its width—a square—and two cubits its height; its horns were of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he overlaid it with pure gold—its top and its sides all around and its horns—and he made for it a gold molding all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made for it two gold rings under its molding on two opposite sides as holders for poles to carry it with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the poles of acacia wood, and he overlaid them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the holy anointing oil and the pure fragrant incense—work of a perfumer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the burnt-offering altar of acacia wood; its length was five cubits, and its width was five cubits—it was square—and its height was three cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made its horns on its four corners; its horns were of one piece with it; and he overlaid it with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made all the equipment of the altar—the pots and the shovels and the sprinkling bowls and the forks and the fire pans—all its equipment he made with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made for the altar a grating, a work of bronze network under its ledge, below, up to its middle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cast four rings on the four ends of the bronze grating as holders for the poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the poles of acacia wood, and he overlaid them with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar to carry it with them. He made it hollow with boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the basin of bronze and its stand of bronze from the mirrors of the serving women who served at the entrance of the tent of assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the courtyard; for the south side were the hangings of the court of finely twisted linen, one hundred cubits,
speaker: Narrator

text: with their twenty pillars and their twenty bases of bronze and with the hooks of the pillars and their bands of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the north side the hangings were one hundred cubits with their twenty pillars and their twenty bases of bronze and with the hooks of the pillars and their bands of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the west side fifty cubits of hangings with their ten pillars and their ten bases and with the hooks of the pillars and their bands of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the eastward side, toward sunrise, fifty cubits;
speaker: Narrator

text: fifteen cubits of hangings were to the shoulder, with their three pillars and their three bases,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the second shoulder on each side of the gate of the courtyard were fifteen cubits of hangings, with their three pillars and their three bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the hangings of the courtyard all around were finely twisted linen,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the bases for the pillars were bronze, the hooks of the pillars and their bands were silver, and the overlay of their tops was silver, and all the pillars of the courtyard were banded with silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the screen of the gate of the courtyard was the work of an embroiderer, with blue and purple and crimson yarns and finely twisted linen; it was twenty cubits long and five cubits high, like the hangings of the courtyard,
speaker: Narrator

text: and with their four pillars and their four bases of bronze, with their silver hooks and with their tops and their bands of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the pegs for the tabernacle and for the courtyard all around were bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the records of the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the testimony, which were recorded at the command of Moses, the work of the Levites, in the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bezalel the son of Uri the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, did all that Yahweh commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with him was Oholiab the son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan, a skilled craftsman and a designer and an embroiderer with the blue and with the purple and with the crimson yarns and with the linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the gold used for the work, in the work of the sanctuary, it was the gold of the wave offering—twenty-nine talents and seven hundred and thirty shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the silver recorded from the community was a hundred talents and a thousand seven hundred and seventy-five shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was a bekah for the individual, the half shekel according to the sanctuary shekel, for everyone who was counted, from twenty years old and above, for six hundred and three thousand five hundred and fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was one hundred talents of the silver to cast the bases of the sanctuary and the bases of the curtain—one hundred bases for one hundred talents of silver, a talent for each base.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from the thousand seven hundred and seventy-five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, and he overlaid their tops, and he made bands for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the bronze of the wave offering was seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made with it the bases of the entrance of the tent of assembly and the bronze altar and the bronze grating that belonged to it and all the equipment of the altar
speaker: Narrator

text: and the bases of the courtyard all around and the bases of the gate of the courtyard and all the pegs of the tabernacle and all the pegs of the courtyard all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from the blue and the purple and the crimson yarns they made woven garments for serving in the sanctuary, and they made the holy garments that were for Aaron, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the ephod of gold, blue, and purple and crimson yarns, and finely twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hammered out the leaves of gold, and he cut off cords to weave in the midst of the blue and in the midst of the purple and in the midst of the crimson and in the midst of the linen—the work of a skilled craftsman.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made joined shoulder pieces for it; it was joined on its two edges.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waistband of his ephod, which was of one piece with it, was of like work, gold, blue, and purple and crimson yarns, and finely twisted linen, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made onyx stones mounted in gold filigree settings, engraved with seal engravings according to the names of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set them on the ephod’s shoulder pieces as stones of remembrance for the Israelites, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the breast piece, the work of a skilled craftsman, like the work of the ephod, of gold, blue, and purple and crimson yarns, and finely twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was squared; they made the breast piece doubled; its length was a span, and its width was a span when doubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they filled it with four rows of stone; a row of carnelian, topaz, and emerald was the first row;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the second row was a malachite, a sapphire, and a moonstone;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the third row was a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the fourth row was a turquoise, an onyx, and a jasper. They were set with gold filigree settings in their mountings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the stones were according to the names of the Israelites; they were twelve according to their names, with seal engravings, each according to its name for the twelve tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made on the breast piece braided chains, a work of pure gold ornamental cord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made two gold filigree settings and two gold rings, and they put the two rings on the two edges of the breast piece.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they put the two gold ornamental cords on the two rings on the edges of the breast piece.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they put the two ends of the two ornamental cords on the two filigree settings, and they put them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod at the front of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made two gold rings, and they placed them on the two edges of the breast piece, on its lip that is on the other side of the ephod, to the inside.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made two gold rings and put them on the ephod’s two shoulder pieces below, at its front near its seam above the waistband of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they tied the breast piece by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a blue cord so that the breast piece would be on the waistband of the ephod and not come loose from the ephod, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the robe of the ephod, weaver’s work, totally of blue yarn.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the opening of the robe in the middle of it was like the opening of a sturdy garment, with an edge for its opening all around so that it would not be torn.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made on the hem of the robe pomegranates of finely twisted blue and purple and crimson.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made pure gold bells and put the bells in the midst of the pomegranates on the hem of the robe all around in the midst of the pomegranates,
speaker: Narrator

text: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate on the hem of the robe all around for serving, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made the tunics of fine linen, a weaver’s work, for Aaron and for his sons,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the turban of fine linen and the headdresses of the headbands of fine linen and undergarments of the linen cloth, finely twisted,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sash of finely twisted linen and blue and purple and crimson yarns, the work of an embroiderer, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made the rosette of the holy diadem of pure gold, and they wrote on it with the writing of seal engravings: “A holy object for Yahweh.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they put a blue cord on it to put it above on the turban, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of assembly was finished, and the Israelites had done according to all that Yahweh had commanded Moses; so they did.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent and all its equipment, its hooks, its frames, its bars, and its pillars and its bases;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the covering of the red-dyed ram skins and the covering of fine leather and the curtain of the screen;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ark of the testimony and its poles and the atonement cover;
speaker: Narrator

text: the table, all its equipment, and the bread of the presence;
speaker: Narrator

text: the pure gold lampstand, its lamps—the lamps of the row—and all its equipment and the oil of the light;
speaker: Narrator

text: the gold altar, the anointing oil, the fragrant incense, and the screen of the entrance of the tent;
speaker: Narrator

text: the bronze altar, and the bronze grating that is for it, its poles, and all its equipment, the basin and its stand,
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the courtyard, its pillars, and its bases; and the screen for the courtyard gate, its tent cords and its pegs; and all the equipment of the service of the tabernacle for the tent of assembly,
speaker: Narrator

text: the woven garments for serving in the sanctuary—the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments for his sons to serve as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to all that Yahweh had commanded Moses, so the Israelites did all the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses saw all the work, and, indeed, they had done it as Yahweh had commanded; so they did, and Moses blessed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the first day of the month, you will set up the tabernacle of the tent of assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will put there the ark of the testimony, and you will cover over the ark with the curtain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will bring the table, and you will arrange its setting, and you will bring the lampstand, and you will set up its lamps.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will put the gold altar for incense before the ark of the testimony, and you will set up the entrance screen for the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will put the altar of the burnt offering before the entrance of the tabernacle of the tent of assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will put the basin between the tent of assembly and the altar, and you will put water in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will set up the courtyard all around, and you will put up the screen of the gate of the courtyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you will take the anointing oil, and you will anoint the tabernacle and all that is in it, and you will consecrate all of its equipment, and it will be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will anoint the altar of the burnt offering and all of its equipment, and you will consecrate the altar, and the altar will be a most holy thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will anoint the basin and its stand, and you will consecrate it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of assembly, and you will wash them with the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will clothe Aaron with the holy garments, and you will anoint him, and you will consecrate him, and he will serve as a priest for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will bring his sons, and you will clothe them with tunics.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will anoint them as you anointed their father, and they will serve as priests for me. And their anointing will be for them to be a lasting priesthood throughout their generations.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses did according to all that Yahweh had commanded him; so he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the first month of the second year, on the first of the month, the tabernacle was set up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses raised the tabernacle, and he placed its bases, and he set up its frames, and he placed its bars, and he raised its pillars.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he spread the tent over the tabernacle; he placed the covering of the tent over it, above it, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took and he put the testimony into the ark, and he placed the poles on the ark, and he put the atonement cover on the ark, above it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought the ark into the tabernacle, and he set up the curtain of the screening, and he shielded the ark of the testimony, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the table in the tent of assembly on the north side of the tabernacle outside the curtain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he arranged on it an arrangement of bread before Yahweh, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he placed the lampstand in the tent of assembly opposite the table on the south side of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set up the lamps before Yahweh, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he placed the gold altar in the tent of assembly before the curtain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he turned fragrant incense into smoke on it, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set up the entrance screen for the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the altar of burnt offering he placed at the entrance of the tabernacle of the tent of assembly, and he offered on it the burnt offering and the grain offering, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he placed the basin between the tent of assembly and the altar, and he put there water for washing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: At their going into the tent of assembly and at their approaching the altar, they washed, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set up the courtyard all around the tabernacle and the altar, and he put up the screen of the gate of the courtyard, and Moses completed the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the cloud covered the tent of assembly, and the glory of Yahweh filled the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses was unable to go into the tent of assembly because the cloud settled on it and the glory of Yahweh filled the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the cloud was lifted from the tabernacle, the Israelites set out on all their journeys.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the cloud was not lifted, they did not set out until the day of its being lifted.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the cloud of Yahweh was on the tabernacle by day, and fire was on it by night before the eyes of all the house of Israel throughout all their journeys.
speaker: Narrator
